description:
On a moonlit night, Akira Masaki finds herself in a magical world where wizards and humans coexist. Every year, they must face an enormous, deadly moon that attacks the planet. Their only hope lies with the Wizards of the Sage, appointed to fight the supernatural threat. But Akira soon discovers she wasn’t summoned by chance—she was chosen to lead them in battle.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: Animation project for Mahoutsukai no Yakusoku announced during the stream event "Mahoutsukai no Yakusoku 4-Shuunen Kinen Tokuban: Mahoyaku 4-Shuunen Goukon" held on Nov 12, 2023.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/龍輪直征)

He began his career in 2000 as an animator at Studio Giants; in 2004, he began working for [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/), where in 2011 he made his debut as a director with [Katte ni Kaizou](https://anilist.co/anime/10191/). In 2016 he left Shaft and went freelance. In 2019, he started working for [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/).

__[Website](http://projectmili.com)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ProjectMili)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/projectmili/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ProjectMili)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/ProjectMili)__

Indie band “Mili” consists of: Canadian vocalist [Cassie Wei](https://anilist.co/staff/188041/Cassie-Wei), capable of writing lyrics in three languages. Composer and arranger [Yamato Kasai](https://anilist.co/staff/168859), with a proven track record of providing music to various artists, such as Higuchi Ai, DAOKO, and Hanazawa Kana. Bassist [Yukihito Mitomo](https://anilist.co/staff/189705/Yukihito-Mitomo) and drummer [Shoto Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/189704/Shoto-Yoshida) are long-time musicians who have gone through both indie and major debuts. Animator, illustrator, and character designer [Ao Fujimori](https://anilist.co/staff/159213/Ao-Fujimori), an experienced animation director, is in charge of Mili's visual artwork.

Mili has written music for popular anime and game titles such as "Ghost in the Shell", "Goblin Slayer", "Limbus Company", "Library of Ruina", "ENDER LILIES", and "Promise of Wizard". They create music in various genres, such as classical, electronic, rock, and jazz, while maintaining a high level of quality. They handle music, visual art, merchandise, management, and business all by themselves. Mili is fully in control of their production and is recognized as a unique presence both domestically and internationally.

They are also producing many songs for anime, game, and IT companies in Japan, Korea, China, Canada, and Poland.

(Source: Spotify, edited)

LipxLip is a fictional music duo, consisting of Yujiro and Aizo, which are characters from the franchise Confession Executive Committee (who are voiced by Kouki Uchiyama and Nobunaga Shimazaki) (Source: lovecommittee.fandom.com)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/momocashew)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/momocashew/)__

Cassie Wei is a Chinese-Canadian vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of [Mili](https://anilist.co/staff/129398/Mili).

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Sometime in early 2019, the circle began to include subunits: s×c, a duo comprised of shito and cake; and HoneyMonster, comprised of Gom (Kouto), cake, and Nakanishi. The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. In addition, ten light novels, based on the Confession Executive Committee Love Series songs "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu", "Yakimochi no Kotae", "Hatsukoi no Ehon", "Ima ni Suki Naru.", "Koi-Iro ni Sake", "Kinyoubi no Ohayou", "Heart no Shuchou", "Ijiwaru na Deai", "Boku ga Namae wo Yobu Hi", and "Daikirai na Hazu Datta." have been released so far. A short novella about the song "Watashi, Idol Sengen" was also included with a CHiCO with Honeyworks album. Light novels for HoneyWorks' other songs do exist as well; the Love and Hate Trilogy ("Nakimushi Kareshi", "Suki-Kirai", "Hajimari no Sayonara") and "Sekai wa Koi ni Ochiteiru" and its sequel "Koi no Chord" both received one.

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. __[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HAMOloid) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hamoloid/)__

__Yamato Kasai__, alternatively known as HAMO, is a Japanese guitarist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of classical music group [Mili](https://anilist.co/staff/129398/Mili).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HAMOloid) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hamoloid/)__
